name: int3
params: wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3

body.origin:
|- wvd1(wvhc2(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3))
-| wi(wa(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3))

cumulated.origin:
|- wvd1(wvhc2(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3))
-| wi(wa(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3))

|- wvd1(wvhc2(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3))
-| wi(w3a(w0, w1, w2), w3)

|- wvd1(wvhc2(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3))
-| wvd1(wvhc3(w0, w1, w2), w3)

comment: The virtual deduction introduction rule of converting the end virtual hypothesis of 3 virtual hypotheses into an antecedent. Conventional form of ~ int3 is ~ 3expia . (Contributed by Alan Sare, 13-Jun-2015.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
